## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.driverkit/documentation/DriverKit/kIOReturnSuccess] on success, or another value if an error occurs. See [doc://com.apple.driverkit/documentation/DriverKit/error-codes].

## Discussion

Don’t override this method or call it from your own code. Existing dispatch source objects implement this method internally and use it to generate new events.

# CheckForWork

**Instance Method**

Checks for events to handle.

## Declaration

```swift
kern_return_t CheckForWork(bool synchronous);
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.driverkit/documentation/DriverKit/kIOReturnSuccess] on success, or another value if an error occurs. See [doc://com.apple.driverkit/documentation/DriverKit/error-codes].

## Discussion

Don’t override this method or call it from your own code. Existing dispatch source objects implement this method internally and use it to generate new events.
title: CheckForWork
